manor_history: Blackwood Manor was built in 1742 by Colonel Cornelius Blackwood. It's rumored to be cursed ('Blackwood Blood-Tithe') due to being built on a pagan circle. Every Lord has died mysteriously.
manor_layout: The Manor has a Grand Hall, Library, Study (with a safe behind a painting), Dining Room, Kitchen, Conservatory, Cellar (rumored to be haunted), and Bedrooms upstairs.
victim_bio: Lord Alistair Blackwood was a tyrant, made his fortune in opium, and was paranoid. Hated by tenants and family alike.
will_rumors: Alistair changed his will 6 months ago to favor Victoria. Rumor has it he threatened to change it again the night he died to favor a 'secret benefactor'.
storm_info: A violent storm has raged for hours, washing out the only bridge back to town. The phone lines are dead. No one can leave, and no help can come.
conservatory_knowledge: The Conservatory is the pride of the manor, housing many rare and exotic plants. Dr. Thorne maintains the collection with obsessive care, particularly the medicinal herbs. Lady Victoria is also a frequent visitor, tending to the decorative orchids as an amateur gardener.
guests_overview: Guests: Lady Victoria (Wife), Arthur (Brother), Dr. Thorne (Physician), Miss Scarlet (Mystery Guest), Jeeves (Butler), Chef Pierre, Maid Mary.
player_identity: THE PLAYER: The stranger who has just arrived is the Inspector from Scotland Yard. You called for them (or expected them). You must treat them as the authority figure investigating the murder.
providence_trust: The Providence Medical Trust is a world-renowned research hospital and charity led by Dr. Thorne. It is the pride of the London medical community and Lord Blackwood's favorite philanthropy.
victim_condition: The body was found with blue lips and pale skin, signs of respiratory failure. It resembles a drug overdose.
